verses.roman:
ko nv ayam nara-vaidūryaḥ
kasya vā kamalekṣaṇaḥ
dhṛtaḥ kayā vā jaṭhare
keyaṁ labdhā tv anena vā

synonyms: kaḥ—who; nu—indeed; ayam—this; nara-vaidūryaḥ—gem among men; kasya—whose (son); vā—and; kamala-īkṣaṇaḥ—lotus-eyed; dhṛtaḥ—carried; kayā—by what woman; vā—and; jaṭhare—in her womb; kā—who; iyam—this woman; labdhā—obtained; tu—moreover; anena—by Him; vā—and.
translation: [Śrīmatī Rukmiṇī-devī said:] Who is this lotus-eyed jewel among men? What man's son is He, and what woman carried Him in her womb? And who is this woman He has taken as His wife?
